FuncDef: This command creates a range of ISIDs associated with a specified route-target that is advertised with BMAC-ISID and IMET-ISID routes for the ISID. The route-target can be explicitly configured or automatically assigned by the system if theauto-rtoption is configured. Auto routes assignment is based on RFC 7623 as follows:

ParaDef.Info: Specifies the start of the ISID range. Values-1 to 16777215.
Specifies the end of the ISID range. If it is not configured, the range is comprised of (only) the ISID specified in the to option. Values-1 to 16777215.
Automatically generates an ISID-derived route-target in the format: AS_number:0x30+ISID.
Specifies an explicit route target. Values-rt - target:{<ip-addr:comm-val>|<2byte-as-number:extcomm-val>|<4byte-asnumber:comm-val>}.
